Incident_details.Incident_name: Illegal sale of tobacco products near an educational institution
Incident_details.description: The accused was found selling 10 HANS tobacco packets within 100 meters of an educational institution, violating the Tobacco Act. Upon questioning, he admitted his offense. The accused was arrested at 17:45, and the seized tobacco packets were documented at 18:00. The case was registered at Avloor Police Station under FIR No. 56/2022 U/S 6 (b) 24 (1) of the Tobacco Act. The accused was presented for medical examination and handed over to police custody.
Incident_details.Witnesses: Police officers present at the scene

Incident_details.description: The complainant and his family left their house at 9:00 AM for farming. Upon returning at 12:30 PM, they found the main door broken and their wardrobe ransacked. Rs. 2,000 was stolen from the complainant's coat pocket. Upon investigating, they found a person hiding inside the bathroom. When confronted, the accused attempted to escape but fell on the road, injuring himself. The stolen money was recovered from his pocket. The accused was taken to Oddanchatram Government Hospital and later shifted to Dindigul Government Hospital for further treatment.

Police officers found an unknown person sitting in the dark, covered and talking suspiciously. Upon noticing the police, the individual attempted to flee but was captured. Initially, the person provided inconsistent addresses before revealing the correct one. Due to suspicion of potential criminal intent, the person was detained at 03:30 AM and taken to the police station for further inquiry. The case was registered under FIR No. 10/2017 U/S 41(1) CRPC.
Incident_details.Witnesses: Police team present at the scene

Incident_details.Location: Dharapuram to Alangiyam Road, near Alangiyam Roundabout
Incident_details.description: A Bolero vehicle driven rashly collided with the complainant's brother's Honda Activa, causing injuries.

Incident_details.Location: Irumbedu Junction, Arani to Arcot Road

Incident_details.description: The complainant and her sister were returning home after attending a funeral when the accused engaged in a verbal altercation with her father. When the complainant intervened, the accused verbally abused her, physically assaulted her using sticks and iron rods, and threatened to kill her if she returned to Mampazhapattu. She sustained injuries and received treatment at Villupuram hospital.

Complainant_details.Name: Ajithkumar
Complainant_details.Address: Chinna Manikkam Pangu, Kaliyamman Kovil Street, Tharangambadi Taluk

Incident_details.description: During a patrol enforcing the COVID-19 lockdown imposed by the Tamil Nadu government from 24-03-2020 midnight for 21 days, the accused was found roaming in a public place in a Maruti Alto car (PY-02-S-2175) without a valid reason. Despite government orders restricting public movement, he failed to comply and was arrested at 12:45 PM.

Incident_details.Location: Kanna Lodge, Jolarpet Junction, New Hotel Street
Incident_details.description: During surveillance related to prohibition enforcement, the accused was found carrying a polythene bag containing 250 packets of LEGACY XXX RUM (90ML) with a Karnataka seal. Upon opening two packets, a strong toxic odor was detected, raising suspicion of adulteration. The accused dropped the bag and fled, evading arrest. The illicit liquor was seized in the presence of police witnesses at 12:15 PM, and a case was registered.
Incident_details.Witnesses: Police officers present at the scene

Incident_details.description: The complainant parked his two-wheeler (TN 31 AC 3251 XL Heavy Duty) in front of the Panchayat Union Primary School in Anna Nagar Colony at 9:30 PM on 17-01-2022. When he returned at 6:00 AM on 18-01-2022, the vehicle was missing. A case was registered based on the complaint.

Incident_details.Location: Near Water Tank, Krishna Iyer School, Chinnamanur
Incident_details.description: The accused was found illegally possessing 8 bottles of liquor (180ml each, labeled BLACK PEARL BRANDY) without government approval. When questioned, he admitted to keeping the bottles for sale. He attempted to flee but was apprehended by the police team. The liquor bottles were seized in the presence of official witnesses.

The deceased, Palavesam, consumed poison and was found dead by his father, Paramasivan, at 08:45 AM on 26-03-2024. The complainant, Avvaiyar Selvi, mentioned that the deceased was addicted to alcohol and was mentally disturbed due to financial stress and lack of children. No suspicion regarding the death was raised by the family.

Incident_details.Incident_name: Verbal abuse and threat with sickle
Incident_details.description: The accused, Palraj, tied the complainant's mother's cow near his field and verbally abused and threatened her brother with a sickle. His sister, Silethu, also verbally abused the complainant's brother.

Accused_details.Name: Koshal
Accused_details.Address: Bihar State, Currently residing in Mettupalayam

Incident_details.description: During a night patrol, police encountered an individual behaving suspiciously at Mettupalayam Bus Stand. Upon questioning, he provided inconsistent details about his identity but later confirmed his name as Koshal (29), from Bihar. Due to suspicion that a crime might occur, he was taken into custody at 03:30 AM and brought to the station at 04:00 AM, where an FIR was registered under Section 41(ii) CrPC.

During a prohibition enforcement patrol in Chinnasalem, police noticed an individual at a roadside petty shop handing over liquor bottles in exchange for money. Upon seeing the police, the suspect attempted to flee but was apprehended. A search revealed 36 bottles of Briharis Brandy, 24 bottles of Golden Choice Brandy, and 6 unsealed bottles emitting a strong, toxic odor, suspected to be adulterated. The suspect lacked legal permission for possession and sale. A total of ₹830 in cash and the liquor bottles were seized at 13:15, sealed, and sent for chemical analysis. The accused was arrested at 13:10 and taken to the station at 14:00, where an FIR was registered under Sections 4(1)(a), 4(1)(h), 4(1)(i) of the Tamil Nadu Prohibition Act.

Accused_details.Name: Muruganandam
Accused_details.Address: Kurinji Garden, Kallimandhayam, Oddanchatram Taluk, Dindigul District

Incident_details.description: The accused allegedly forged a stamp paper (Rs. 20/-) dated 14-08-2018 and altered the date to 11-03-2018 to deceive the public regarding a land purchase for a temple. The complainant, upon verification with the Oddanchatram stamp vendor, discovered that the original stamp paper was sold to a different individual, proving the forgery. The accused collected funds from the public under false pretenses of purchasing land for the temple. Previous complaints had been filed under Cr.No. 28/17 at Dindigul DCB Police Station, but the case was dropped. Based on new evidence, the complainant approached the authorities again.

Accused_details.Name: Ellappa
Accused_details.Address: Sanaboganapalli Village, Devakanapalli Post, Denkanikottai Taluk, Krishnagiri District

Incident_details.description: The accused was using offensive language, shouting vulgar words at the public. Despite being warned, he continued to do so and was subsequently arrested at 13:30. His family was informed, and he was taken to the station at 14:00.

The complainant's father, Radhakrishnan (58), a former prepaid taxi driver, was found dead near Chennai Airport. Due to financial struggles and alcohol addiction, he had been staying there occasionally. On 17-04-2023, he left Kanchipuram for Chennai and was later found deceased on 20-04-2023 at 05:30 AM. The complainant identified the body and requested its release for final rites.

Incident_details.Location: Pattaraavuthar Mantoppu, near Sandanakaruppu Temple, Natham
Incident_details.description: The complainant's father, Radhakrishnan (59), had been experiencing vision issues after a fall two months ago. He had been distressed and expressed suicidal thoughts. On 12-01-2024, he visited his daughter’s house in Natham but left after a short stay. On 14-01-2024, he was found dead near Sandanakaruppu Temple with a MONOMAR pesticide bottle and a Belma cold drink bottle nearby, indicating he consumed poison. The complainant confirmed there were no suspicions regarding the death.

In doing so, he collided with Venkataraj’s two-wheeler, causing him to fall. Venkataraj sustained injuries to his head, left ear, and left hand. He was taken to Srinivasa Hospital in Bengaluru for treatment. The complainant has requested action against the lorry driver.

The complainant's younger brother, Palanisamy (32), who is mentally challenged and mute, left home wearing a white checkered shirt and cement-colored pants on 20-11-2019 at 07:00 AM and has not returned since. Despite searching nearby areas and relatives' houses, he remains missing.

The complainant visited his mother's house in Sirukadambur to discuss his share of the property. During the conversation, his elder brother Krishnamurthy and nephew Maaveeran physically assaulted him. Krishnamurthy pushed him against a wall, and Maaveeran struck him with a firewood stick, causing injuries. The complainant suffered chest pain and later sought treatment at the Ariyalur Government Hospital.

The accused threatened bystanders with the rod before escaping.

Incident_details.description: During a routine patrol near the post office, the police identified suspicious individuals hiding in the dark with their faces covered. Upon questioning, they initially provided false information but later revealed their identities. As they could not provide a valid reason for being there, they were suspected of potential criminal intent and were taken into custody.

During a routine patrol, police found the accused carrying a bag containing six bottles of Black Pearal Brandy (180ml) without legal authorization. The liquor was seized, documented in the presence of police officials, and destroyed at the scene. The accused was arrested on the spot and taken to the police station.

Incident_details.description: During an inspection related to the prohibition of liquor, the accused was found sitting with a plastic bag containing five bottles of Top Star Brandy (180ml). Upon questioning, he admitted to purchasing the liquor from a government liquor shop and reselling it at a higher price without legal authorization. The liquor bottles were seized, documented in the presence of police officials, and the accused was arrested at 16:15.

Accused_details.Name: Prakash
Accused_details.Address: Mariamman Kovil Street, Old Colony, Ailavadi Village, Vandavasi Taluk

Incident_details.Incident_name: Suspicious Behavior and Attempt to Flee
Incident_details.description: While on night patrol, the police noticed the accused at Vadavanakkambadi Bus Stop. Upon seeing the police, he attempted to flee but was apprehended. He provided inconsistent details about his identity and presence at the location. Due to his suspicious behavior, he was arrested at 18:00 under suspicion of potential criminal intent.

Accused_details.Name: Ponmathi
Accused_details.Address: Nadusalai Village, Chennasandiram Post, Krishnagiri Taluk & District

Incident_details.Name: Illegal Possession and Sale of Liquor
Incident_details.Location: Nadusalai Village, Kurubarapalli Police Station Limits
Incident_details.description: During a patrol, the police noticed the accused hiding a bundle behind her house. Upon seeing the officers, she attempted to flee, leaving the bundle behind. She was apprehended and initially provided inconsistent details before admitting that she was illegally storing and selling liquor for profit. The accused was arrested at 19:10, and 5 bottles (180ml each) of Monitor Brandy were confiscated. As no public witnesses came forward, the confiscation was recorded in the presence of police witnesses, and the liquor was destroyed at the spot as per orders.

Incident_details.Name: Suspicious Loitering
Incident_details.description: During patrolling, two individuals attempted to flee upon seeing the police. When apprehended, they provided inconsistent details about their identities before finally identifying themselves as Ramesh and Kumaravel. As they had no valid reason to be present at the location at that time, they were suspected of intending to commit a crime and were arrested on the spot at 04:00. They were taken to the police station at 04:30, formally searched, and handed over to station custody.

Incident_details.Name: Illegal Lottery Ticket Sale
Incident_details.description: Based on a tip-off from an informant, police patrolled Kumuli Bus Stand and identified the accused selling banned Kerala state lottery tickets. The accused voluntarily produced 67 Akshaya lottery tickets (draw date: 21-03-2018) and 60 Karunya Plus lottery tickets (draw date: 22-03-2018), each worth ₹30, totaling ₹3,810. The items were seized in the presence of witnesses, and the accused was taken into custody along with the seized lottery tickets at 08:30.

Incident_details.Location: Periyapottalpatti North, Burma Colony Road, near Selvam's Farm
Incident_details.description: The accused was caught illegally transporting sand in a TN67 AS 8048 tractor with a TN60 H 1330 trailer. Upon interception, he attempted to flee but was apprehended. The sand, valued at approximately Rs. 2000, was seized.

Incident_details.description: Two individuals were found loitering suspiciously and attempted to flee upon seeing the police. Upon questioning, they provided inconsistent statements regarding their identity and presence at the location. Due to reasonable suspicion of potential criminal intent, they were detained as a precautionary measure.

Accused_details.Name: Arumugam
Accused_details.Address: Indira Colony, Dharmathupatti, Kannivadi, Dindigul District

Incident_details.description: The accused was found carrying a white polythene bag containing five 180 ML bottles of Roman Castle Brandy. Upon seeing the police, he attempted to flee but was apprehended. Since no independent witnesses were available, the police team seized and destroyed the liquor on-site and documented the evidence.

Incident_details.Incident_name: Illegal Sale of Banned Tobacco Products
Incident_details.description: The accused was found in possession of government-banned tobacco products, including Hans (5 packets), Uma Podi (15 packets), MDM Pakku (50 packets), and Vimal Pakku (20 packets). Upon noticing the police, the accused attempted to flee but was apprehended. Due to the absence of independent witnesses, the police team seized the items in their presence, documented the evidence, and arrested the accused at 17:00 hrs.

He had parked his Bajaj Pulsar 220 SF (KA 40 V 5289, Black) in front of the Mahal at 21:30 hrs on 10-01-2023. The next morning at 07:30 hrs, he found that the vehicle was missing. Despite searching the surroundings, he could not find it. It is suspected that unknown individuals broke the vehicle lock and stole it.

Accused_details.Name: Chinnraj
Accused_details.Address: Gowapparai Village, Ellapudayampatti Post, Harur Taluk, Dharmapuri District

Incident_details.description: The accused was found behind his house with two white sacks. Upon noticing the police, he attempted to flee but was apprehended. The seized liquor included 180 Mens Club -52, Black Pearl -25, Copper -49, Express -95, 650 TL Black Pearl Triple-20, Holandas -22, Zingaro -3, and British Empire Premium -28, totaling 294 bottles. Due to the absence of independent witnesses, the police team documented the evidence and destroyed the seized liquor on-site, as per legal protocols. The accused was arrested and brought to the station at 15:00 hrs.

The complainant, along with his wife and two children, resides in Vilakucheri. Due to an ongoing dispute over wood cutting and water flow in a canal with residents of Sammanenthal, an altercation occurred on 11-01-2024 at 18:30 hrs. When the complainant was near the village bus stop, the accused Hemnathan verbally abused him, pushed him to the ground, and, along with other accused individuals, physically assaulted him. The complainant's wife, father, and a villager named Thangaraj intervened. The accused then threatened to kill the complainant if he interfered in their matters again. The complainant was taken to Thiruchuli Government Hospital for treatment and later filed this complaint.

Upon police intervention, others fled, but Malar was caught with seven 180ML glass bottles of government IMFL liquor. The accused admitted to selling liquor without government permission. Incident_details.description: During night patrol, police noticed two suspicious individuals near AXIS ATM, Tiruppur Road, Kangayam. Upon seeing the police, they attempted to flee but were caught and interrogated. They provided conflicting and unclear address details. As they could potentially commit a crime if left unchecked, they were arrested as a precautionary measure.

Incident_details.Location: Near AXIS ATM, Tiruppur Road, Kangayam
Incident_details.description: During night patrol, police noticed two suspicious individuals near AXIS ATM, Tiruppur Road, Kangayam. Upon seeing the police, they attempted to flee but were caught and interrogated. They provided conflicting and unclear address details. As they could potentially commit a crime if left unchecked, they were arrested as a precautionary measure.

Accused_details.Name: Subramani
Accused_details.Address: Rajiv Gandhi Nagar, Danishpet, Kadaiyampatti Taluk, Salem District

Incident_details.Location: Near Rajiv Gandhi Nagar, Danishpet, Theevattipatti Police Limits
Incident_details.description: Police noticed Subramani attempting to flee near his house. Upon being caught and interrogated, he admitted to selling illegal lottery tickets from Kerala without government authorization. The police seized printed lottery tickets marked 'KERALA ROJA 12.1.2021 R 367481 TO R 367490' along with ₹100 from sales. The accused was arrested at 19:15 Hrs.

Incident_details.Location: Complainant's Residence, Munnur, Poikakaraipatti, Madurai District
Incident_details.description: The complainant's husband, Sudhakar, who was addicted to alcohol, returned home drunk at 23:00 Hrs and refused to give money for household expenses, leading to an argument. Later, at 01:30 Hrs, the complainant found him hanging from an iron rod in the house. With the help of relatives, they cut the saree used for hanging and rushed him to a hospital. He was declared dead upon arrival at the Government Hospital in Madurai.
Incident_details.Witnesses: Mahadevan, Mookayi, Alaguraja, Vishnu, Mathi, Ramar

Incident_details.Location: Complainant's Residence, Munnur, Poikakaraipatti, Madurai District
Incident_details.description: The complainant's husband, Sudhakar, who was addicted to alcohol, returned home drunk at 23:00 Hrs and refused to give money for household expenses, leading to an argument. Later, at 01:30 Hrs, the complainant found him hanging from an iron rod in the house. With the help of relatives, they cut the saree used for hanging and rushed him to a hospital. He was declared dead upon arrival at the Government Hospital in Madurai.
Incident_details.Witnesses: Mahadevan, Mookayi, Alaguraja, Vishnu, Mathi, Ramar

Incident_details.Location: Complainant's Residence, Munnur, Poikakaraipatti, Madurai District
Incident_details.description: The complainant's husband, Sudhakar, who was addicted to alcohol, returned home drunk at 23:00 Hrs and refused to give money for household expenses, leading to an argument. Later, at 01:30 Hrs, the complainant found him hanging from an iron rod in the house. With the help of relatives, they cut the saree used for hanging and rushed him to a hospital. He was declared dead upon arrival at the Government Hospital in Madurai.
Incident_details.Witnesses: Mahadevan, Mookayi, Alaguraja, Vishnu, Mathi, Ramar

Incident_details.Location: Kosur, in front of EB Office
Incident_details.description: The accused was found in possession of 180ml Men's Club brandy bottles (5 bottles) without government authorization. He admitted to keeping them for illegal sale at a higher price. The police seized and destroyed the liquor bottles at the scene under official supervision.
The complainant was present at the Taluk Office for a public auction when the accused verbally abused his father and physically assaulted him by grabbing his shirt and attacking him.
Incident_details.Witnesses: Local villagers present at the auction

Incident_details.description: The complainant's brother Bhoopalakrishnan was involved in a road accident when a Tata ACE (TN 42 B 1003) collided with his TVS Apache (TN 42 C 2985). He sustained severe head injuries, underwent treatment at multiple hospitals, and later succumbed to his injuries on 22-01-2018.

Accused_details.Name: Vinoth
Accused_details.Address: Kunnanoor, Kurushethi South Street, Thiruthuraipoondi (TK), Thiruvarur District

Incident_details.description: During a routine vehicle check, a BharatBenz lorry (TN 55 BY 8118) carrying approximately 3 units of river sand was stopped. The driver, Vinoth, confessed that the sand was loaded from Viralimalai by Karthik and Suresh, who also provided a fake bill. Vinoth was arrested at 12:05 PM without coercion, and the lorry along with the fake bill was seized.
Incident_details.Witnesses: Police officers Babu (1785) and Satheesh Kumar (2063)

Investigating_officer.Name: Sivakumar
Investigating_officer.IPC_section: U/S 379, 420 IPC and 21(1)(ii) Tamil Nadu Mines and Minerals Development Regulation Act 1957

Incident_details.Location: In front of Shop No. 28/342, Waltax Road, Chennai
Incident_details.description: The complainant, C. Karnan, and his relative, C. Bharath, were walking along the road when a high-speed and negligent motorbike (TN 04 AR 6027) hit them from behind. C. Bharath suffered head and mouth injuries and was taken to Government Stanley Hospital for treatment. The accused rider fled the scene.

Investigating_officer.Name: P. Devaraj
Investigating_officer.Police_station: C2 Elephant Gate Traffic Investigation Wing

Complainant_details.Name: M. Venkatesan
Complainant_details.Address: Old No.7, New No.13, Nagavalliamman Kovil Street, Gandhi Nagar, Avadi, Chennai-54

Incident_details.description: The complainant's second son, Murali, aged 31, was found hanging from a ceiling fan using his sister-in-law Gomathi’s saree. He had a habit of excessive drinking and was unmarried, leading to mental distress. The complainant and neighbors attempted to save him but found him deceased upon reaching Avadi Government Hospital. The complainant confirms no foul play and requests the body for final rites.

During a police patrol in Chennimalai, officers noticed suspects attempting to flee near Surya Bakery. Upon questioning, they provided inconsistent addresses. Suspecting potential criminal intent, the suspects were arrested at 2:00 PM and brought to the station at 2:30 PM. A case was registered under section 41(1)(a) of CrPC.
Incident_details.Witnesses: Police party present at the scene

Incident_details.description: The accused were found violating the nationwide 144 curfew order issued by the Indian Government on 24-03-2020 to prevent the spread of COVID-19. Despite repeated warnings through television, newspapers, and public announcements, the accused were found loitering unnecessarily. They were arrested at 5:00 PM and brought to Karumanthurai Police Station for further legal action.
Incident_details.Witnesses: Police team present at the scene

Incident_details.description: The complainant's mother, Malaiyamma (72), who was mentally unstable, left her aunt’s house on 13-02-2022 and has been missing since. Despite searching in various places, she was not found. The complainant requests police assistance in locating his missing mother.

The accused was found illegally stocking and selling government liquor bottles at a higher price. Upon interrogation, the accused admitted to purchasing and reselling liquor without proper authorization. A total of seven 180ml bottles of 'Monitor' brand liquor were seized in the presence of police personnel.

Incident_details.Location: Madurai to Rameswaram Main Road, near Meenakshi School, Chathirakudi
Incident_details.description: The complainant was riding a Honda Activa 125 (TN 65 BW 5067) and indicated a right turn near Commonkottai junction. The accused, riding a Splendor Plus (TN 65 BZ 9054) at high speed and carelessly, collided with the complainant’s vehicle, causing him to fall and sustain injuries on his right ankle. He was taken to Ramanathapuram Government Medical College Hospital for treatment.

Complainant_details.Name: M. Hemalatha
Complainant_details.Address: No.9, Mariamman Kovil Street, Veerabogam Village, Cheyyur Taluk, Chengalpattu District

Accused_details.Name: Unknown (Driver of Hyundai i20 TN 19 AW 3663)

Incident_details.Location: Near Government Hospital, Cheyyur, Chengalpattu District
Incident_details.description: The complainant's brother, M. Tamilvanan, was riding his Honda two-wheeler (TN 03 Y 6900) towards Veerabogam when a speeding Hyundai i20 (TN 19 AW 3663) coming from Ellaiamman Temple towards Sittamur hit his vehicle. The victim suffered severe head injuries, nasal bleeding, and wounds on his face and right hand. He was given first aid at Cheyyur Government Hospital and later transferred to Chengalpattu Government Hospital for further treatment. The victim is currently unconscious and undergoing intensive care.

Complainant_details.Name: G. Kuppandi
Complainant_details.Address: No. 85, Kamarajar Nagar, Pallikonda, Anaikattu TK

Incident_details.description: The complainant, G. Kuppandi, an electrician, reported that his wife, K. Dhanuja (24), who stays at home to take care of their two children, Yashwanth (4) and Rishi (3), went missing from their residence on 15-01-2025 at around 12:30 AM. Despite searching among relatives and neighbors, she was not found. The complainant has requested police assistance in locating her.

Accused_details.Name: Sivakumar
Accused_details.Address: Mariamman Kovil Street, V. Puthupalayam Village, Kandachipuram Taluk, Villupuram District

Incident_details.description: During a routine patrol near Palanivel ITI, the police team identified the accused, Sivakumar (35), consuming intoxicating liquor in a public place and behaving in an intoxicated manner, causing public disturbance. He was arrested at 18:40 hours in compliance with Supreme Court guidelines and taken to Kandachipuram Police Station at 19:00 hours for further legal action.

Accused_details.Name: Sivakumar
Accused_details.Address: Mariyamman Kovil Street, V. Pudupalayam Village, Kandachipuram Taluk, Villupuram District

Incident_details.Incident_name: Public Intoxication and Possession of Intoxicating Liquor
Incident_details.description: During a routine patrol near Palanivel ITI, the police team noticed the accused, Sivakumar (35), under the influence of intoxicants in a public place. He was found consuming illicit liquor in a way that disturbed public peace. Upon questioning, he failed to provide a valid reason for his actions. He was arrested at 18:40, following all Supreme Court guidelines, and was taken to the Kandachipuram Police Station at 19:00 hours for further proceedings.

Name: Saranraj, Age: 31/22, S/O Shanmugam, Mulaiyur, Gnanammal Kovil Street, Thanjavur
Chandru, Age: 221/22, S/O Radhakrishnan, Melatheru, Chandrasekapuram, Valangaiman Taluk, Thiruvarur District

Incident_details.description: During a night patrol in Arithuvaramangalam jurisdiction, the police team noticed two individuals standing suspiciously near the bus stop. Upon questioning, they provided inconsistent and contradictory addresses. After further interrogation, they revealed their actual identities. Due to reasonable suspicion, they were arrested at 03:00 hours and taken to the police station at 03:30 hours for further investigation.

Name: Saranraj, S/O Shanmugam, Age 31, Residing at Gnanaammal Temple Street, Moolaiyur, Thanjavur
Santhru, S/O Radhakrishnan, Age 22, Residing at Melatheru, Chandrasekapuram, Valangaiman Taluk, Thiruvarur District
Address: Melatheru, Chandrasekapuram, Valangaiman Taluk, Thiruvarur District

Incident_details.description: During a routine patrol near Kandamangalam Bus Stand, the police team noticed two individuals sitting with their faces covered with cloth. When questioned, they attempted to flee but were apprehended by the police. Upon further questioning, they provided inconsistent names and addresses before finally revealing their true identities. Due to their suspicious behavior and failure to provide a valid reason for their presence, they were arrested at 04:15 hours and taken to the police station at 04:30 hours for further inquiry.

During a routine patrol to enforce COVID-19 lockdown restrictions, the police team found the accused, Pandi (S/O Govindaraj), recklessly roaming on his two-wheeler despite repeated warnings. The accused knowingly violated Section 144 CrPC and endangered public health by ignoring government-imposed lockdown restrictions meant to prevent the spread of the coronavirus. He was arrested at the location at 17:45 and brought to the police station at 18:15 along with his vehicle.

Investigating_officer.Name: M. Sriram
Investigating_officer.IPC_section: 188, 269, 270, 279 IPC r/w 3 of Epidemic Diseases Act 1897 & Disaster Management Act 51(b) 2005

Incident_details.description: Saranya, daughter of the complainant, went missing on 25-12-2018 along with another woman from her workplace. It was later discovered that she was in a relationship with Saddam Hussain and had traveled to Kerala. Upon returning, they attempted suicide by consuming poison due to fear of being separated. Saranya was admitted to multiple hospitals for treatment but succumbed to poisoning on 03-01-2019 at 18:25. The complaint was filed on 04-01-2019 at 07:00, leading to case registration under CrPC 174.

Incident_details.Incident_name: Suspicious Behavior and Possession of Wire
Incident_details.description: During a night patrol, the police team noticed a suspicious individual near Ottanchathiram Bus Stand. The suspect attempted to flee but was caught. Initially, he provided false details, but after further inquiry, he revealed his real identity. A small wire was found in his possession. Since he failed to provide a valid reason for being there, he was arrested on suspicion and taken to the police station, where a case was registered under Section 41(1)(d) CrPC.

Complainant_details.Name: K. Maruthamuthu
Complainant_details.Address: Palani Nagar Police Station, Dindigul District

Incident_details.description: During a night patrol, the police team noticed a suspicious individual near Sami Theatre. Upon seeing the police, he attempted to flee but was apprehended. Initially, he provided false identity details but later confirmed his real address. As he failed to give a valid reason for being there at that time, he was arrested as a preventive measure and brought to the station. A case was registered under Section 41(1)(d) CrPC, and he was later remanded after a detailed inquiry.

While on night patrol, the officer observed a suspicious individual standing near the Kottur ration shop. Upon noticing the police, the individual attempted to flee but was apprehended. During questioning, the suspect provided conflicting information about his identity and address, raising suspicion. Concerned that he might commit an offense if left unchecked, the police arrested him at 02:00 hrs. The arrest details were communicated to his relatives, and he was taken to the station at 02:30 hrs for further verification. A case was registered under Cr No: 20/2017, U/S 41(I) CRPC. The original FIR was sent to the Judicial Magistrate, Pandalur, and copies were forwarded to the relevant higher authorities.

During patrol in Mappedu and Kondancheri, the police noticed two individuals hiding near Perambakkam Bus Stand. Upon spotting the police, they attempted to flee but were apprehended. When questioned, they failed to provide a valid reason for their presence at the location. Suspecting that they intended to commit a crime, they were arrested at 04:00 hrs and taken to the station at 05:00 hrs for further inquiry. The case was registered under Cr No: 78/2018, U/S 41(1)(a) CrPC. The FIR was sent to the relevant higher authorities for further action.

Complainant_details.Name: A. Great Churchil Jebaraj
Complainant_details.Address: Election Flying Squad No. III, Kadayam Constituency

Incident_details.Incident_name: Election Code Violation - Unauthorized Party Flag Display
Incident_details.description: During a field inspection at Valliyammalpuram village, the Election Flying Squad noticed a flag of the Puthiya Tamizhagam party hoisted on a pole in violation of election conduct rules. Despite instructions to remove it, the flag remained. A case was registered against Ponnusamy, the local branch secretary of the Puthiya Tamizhagam party, under Cr No: 71/19 U/S 283 IPC and Section 4 of TNOPDL Act.
Incident_details.Witnesses: SSI455 Ganesan, HC 2559 Sundarapandi, PC 2856 Rajesh, PC 4064 Muthuraja

Complainant_details.Name: T. Ranjithkumar
Complainant_details.Address: RTR Residency, Vijayagopalapuram Village, Alathur Taluk, Perambalur District

Incident_details.Location: RTR Residency, Vijayagopalapuram Village, Alathur Taluk, Perambalur District
Incident_details.description: On 26-01-2020 at 23:30, the complainant's mother returned home from Tiruchirapalli and placed various gold jewelry items, cash (Rs. 30,000), and a Google Pixel cellphone in a bag inside the bedroom cupboard before sleeping. On 27-01-2020 at 04:00, she noticed light coming through an open bedroom window and alerted the complainant. Upon inspection, they found that an unknown individual had opened the window, taken the valuables from the bag, and left the bag behind. The estimated total value of the stolen items is approximately Rs. 1,06,000.

Incident_details.Incident_name: Possession and Illegal Sale of Liquor
Incident_details.description: On 17-01-2021 at 08:00, Assistant Inspector R. Jeevanandham, along with HC 731 Hariharan and PC 1027 Thujenthan, were monitoring prohibition activities near the backside of the accused's house at Thanduvankulam Pudutheru. The accused, Mohan, was found in possession of three 180ml bottles of DAY NIGHT brandy and was pouring liquor for a nearby individual. Upon seeing the police, he attempted to escape but was caught. When questioned, he admitted to possessing the liquor without any legal permit. The bottles were seized in the presence of police officers at 08:15, and under the orders of the Inspector, the seized liquor was destroyed at the scene at 08:30. The accused was arrested at 08:00 and brought to the police station at 09:00, where a case was registered under 4(1)(K) TNP ACT.

Accused_details.Name: Kumar
Accused_details.Address: South Street, Sellankuppam Village, Villupuram District

Incident_details.description: On 09-01-2022 at 12:15 PM, during lockdown monitoring, Assistant Inspector Ravi along with Head Constable 800 Jayaganesh and Police Constable 326 Mahesh observed Kumar traveling unnecessarily without a mask on PY-01 N-3115, violating government lockdown orders, potentially spreading COVID-19. He was arrested at 12:20 PM, and his vehicle was seized.
Incident_details.Witnesses: Head Constable 800 Jayaganesh, Police Constable 326 Mahesh

Investigating_officer.Name: Ravi
Investigating_officer.IPC_section: 269 IPC r/w 3 of Epidemic Disease Act 1897 & r/w sec 51 of The Disaster Management Act

Incident_details.description: On 07-05-2023 at around 11:00 AM, the complainant parked his two-wheeler (Scooty Pep TN49BK3072) in front of his construction site at Vaishnavi Garden, Plot No. 18. After attending to work inside, he returned around 12:00 PM and found his vehicle missing. Despite searching the surrounding area, he could not locate it. The estimated value of the stolen vehicle is unknown.

Incident_details.Location: Bismillah Chicken Center, Anna Nagar, Hosur
Incident_details.description: Munnah, in an intoxicated state, fell from the stairs and suffered a head injury. He was taken to the hospital at 07:00 AM on 08-02-2024. Despite treatment, he passed away at 07:30 PM on 08-02-2024.

Incident_details.Location: Bos's petty shop, Perungarunai Village, Mudukulathur Taluk
Incident_details.Incident_name: Illegal Sale of Banned Tobacco Products
Incident_details.description: Bos was found selling banned tobacco products, including 15 packets of 'Ganesh 701 Tobacco' (15 grams each), at his petty shop. He admitted to selling them for profit to both adults and minors.
Incident_details.Witnesses: Police party members - Head Constable 1386 Maheswaran and Constable 2663 Muthukrishnan

Investigating_officer.Name: B. Rajkumar
Investigating_officer.IPC_section: 24(1) r/w 6(a) of Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products Act, 2003

Complainant_details.Name: P. Harikrishnan
Complainant_details.Address: No. 5/497, Near Halo Block Shop, Thuraiyur Main Road, Jembunathapuram, Musiri Taluk, Tiruchirappalli District

Incident_details.Location: Hari Welding Works, near Gas Godown, Jembunathapuram
Incident_details.description: Unknown persons broke into the complainant's welding workshop by breaking the lock and stole multiple welding machines and tools, including a 14-inch cutting machine, 4-inch cutting machine, grinding machine, hand drilling machine, welding machine, battery drilling machine, water motor, digital weighing machine, spanner tools, welding cables, and wire box.

Complainant_details.Name: A. Govindaraj
Complainant_details.Address: Vazhakkuttaiyanthoppu, Ambukovil, Karambakudi Taluk, Pudukkottai District

Incident_details.Location: Gandharvakottai - Pattukkottai Road, in front of Matangkal Vasudevan’s house
Incident_details.description: While traveling back home from Kandharvakottai on a Hero Splendor+ (TN 01 BC 3730), the complainant’s mother, Sornam (59), felt dizzy and fell from the vehicle, sustaining a head injury with bleeding from the ear. She was first treated at Kandharvakottai GH and later referred to Thanjavur Medical College for further treatment.
Incident_details.Witnesses: Murugesan (brother of the complainant), Prakash (nephew of the complainant)

Complainant_details.Name: M. Thamimul Ansari
Complainant_details.Address: 1/44, North Street, Eppodumvendran, Ottapidaram Taluk, Thoothukudi District

Incident_details.description: The complainant and his colleague, Balamurugan, were asleep in their rented house when they heard a noise. Upon turning on the light, they saw Kanagaraj and Siva running away. On checking, they found that three mobile phones (VIVO Y33S, VIVO Y91, and OPPO A76) worth approximately ₹44,000 were stolen. The complainant requests the retrieval of the stolen items.

Incident_details.Location: Near Nedungulam Railway Gate, Thiruvathavur, Madurai
Incident_details.description: The complainant's son, Pandiswaran (aged 31), who had suffered memory loss due to a previous accident, was found dead on the railway track near Nedungulam Railway Gate. The complainant states that there is no suspicion regarding his son's death and requests necessary actions for the post-mortem and further procedures.

Incident_details.Location: Near Navalakshmi Jewellery Shop, Muriandampalayam Road
Incident_details.description: During a night patrol, the police team noticed a person covering his face and standing suspiciously. When approached, he attempted to escape but was caught and interrogated. The accused initially gave contradictory details and had no valid reason for being present at the location. As a preventive measure, he was arrested under Section 41(ii) CrPC to prevent any potential criminal activity.

During a night patrol, the police team observed suspicious individuals near an ATM in Thuthipattu Village. Upon questioning, they gave conflicting name and address details and later admitted their identity. They could not provide a valid reason for their presence at the location. To prevent any potential criminal activity, they were arrested under Section 41(1)(a) CrPC.

Accused_details.Name: Ganesh
Accused_details.Address: South Garden, TKN Pudur, Palani Taluk

Incident_details.Location: Near Railway Gate, Ayyakudi to TKN Pudur Road
Incident_details.description: During a night patrol, the police team observed a suspicious individual near the railway gate. Upon questioning, he provided conflicting name and address details before finally revealing his identity as Ganesh, son of Chandraraman, from TKN Pudur. As he could not provide a valid reason for his presence at the location, he was arrested under Section 41(2) CrPC to prevent any potential criminal activity.

Accused_details.Name: Rajesh, Viji, Vinoth
Accused_details.Address: Periyapillai Govindapuram, Kerala; Iqbal Street, Pudukkottai; SSL Dayampathi, Palakkad, Kerala

Incident_details.Incident_name: Suspicious Activity and Possession of Iron Tools
Incident_details.description: During a night patrol, three individuals were found hiding in the dark near Kandasamy Hotel. Upon questioning, they gave conflicting answers and were found in possession of cutting blades, chisels, and other iron tools, raising suspicion of criminal intent.

Incident_details.Incident_name: Suspicious Activity and Attempt to Flee
Incident_details.description: During a night patrol, the accused attempted to flee upon noticing the police team. Upon questioning, he gave conflicting details about his identity and was unable to provide a valid reason for being present at that hour, leading to his preventive arrest.

During a patrol, the accused were found organizing a rooster fight and betting ₹1400. The police team surrounded and arrested them. Due to the absence of independent witnesses, the seized items and accused were brought to the station.

Complainant_details.Name: S. Sivasuriya
Complainant_details.Address: No. 3/2, Veeraraghavan Street, Arisipalayam, Salem District - 636009

Incident_details.Location: SF, 2nd Floor, Block No.5, Jain Sukruti Apartments, Rettipalaiyam Road, Mogappair West, Chennai-37
Incident_details.description: The deceased, R. Ramaprakash, had financial distress due to debts. His friend Ramesh informed the complainant that he was found hanging in his residence. A handwritten note was found nearby stating that he was committing suicide due to excessive debt. The body was found lowered and confirmed dead by 108 ambulance personnel.

Incident_details.Incident_name: Suspicious behavior and attempt to flee
Incident_details.description: A group of suspects were found standing suspiciously in the area. Upon seeing the police, they attempted to flee but were apprehended. Upon inquiry, they provided conflicting statements and could not justify their presence in the location. Based on reasonable suspicion, they were arrested at 03:00 and taken to the police station at 03:30 for further investigation.

Complainant_details.Name: S. Sathiyaseelan
Complainant_details.Address: No. 61, Kakkam Street, A. Mettur, Veppanthattai (TK), Perambalur (DT)

Incident_details.Location: Vijayapuram to Arumbavur Road, A. Mettur
Incident_details.description: The complainant's daughter Yazhika was standing on the roadside when the accused Anand drove the harvester TN 46 D 4143 at high speed and carelessly hit the child. The complainant's wife rushed to check on the child, found no external injuries, but noticed the child was not breathing. The child was taken to Perambalur GH at 11:15 AM, where doctors declared her dead.

Victim_details.Name: Kaliyaperumal
Victim_details.Injury: Multiple head injuries from wooden log attack

Hospital_treatment.Status: Referred to Thiruvarur Medical College Hospital

Incident_details.description: The accused, Balasubramanian, frequently quarreled with his parents over property inheritance. On 08-06-2017 at 05:30 PM, he came home intoxicated, argued with his mother Saraswathi, and attacked her husband Kaliyaperumal with a wooden log, striking multiple times on the head and hands. Neighbors tried to intervene but were threatened. The victim was hospitalized but succumbed to injuries on 09-06-2017 at 08:45 AM.

Incident_details.Location: Near Maruthur North TASMAC Shop No. 5718
Incident_details.description: During surveillance, police noticed suspicious activity behind a shed near TASMAC Shop No. 5718. Upon checking, individuals fled, but Selvam was apprehended for illegally allowing people to consume government liquor and collecting money.

Three individuals were caught gambling with a set of 52 lottery sheets, using Rs. 100 each for betting. Upon noticing the police, they attempted to flee but were captured and arrested as per the Supreme Court order. The confiscated items were documented in the presence of police officers and submitted at the police station.

The complainant was assaulted and threatened by a group of individuals due to a dispute. She suffered internal injuries and was admitted to Mayiladuthurai Government Hospital for treatment. The police recorded her statement and registered a case.

Incident_details.Location: Murugan Petti Shop, Kolukattakudi Aathupalam, Trichy
Incident_details.Incident_name: Illegal Sale of Banned Tobacco Products
Incident_details.description: The accused was found in possession of five packets of banned Ganesh tobacco products with the intent to sell for profit, which is harmful to public health. The accused was arrested at 12:45 PM, and the evidence was seized in the presence of the police party. The case was registered under U/S 6(b) r/w 24(1) COTPA Act and handed over for further legal proceedings.

The accused was found in possession of 110 liters of illicit liquor. Upon police arrival, she attempted to flee but was apprehended. The seized liquor was tested, found to be toxic, and destroyed as per legal procedures. A portion was sealed for evidence.

Accused_details.Name: Nagaraj
Accused_details.Address: Pachaimuthu Nagar, Avadhanapatti Village, Agraharam Post, Krishnagiri Taluk & District

Incident_details.description: The accused was found in possession of 5 bottles of 180ml MC Brandy for illegal sale without government authorization. Upon seeing the police, he attempted to escape but was apprehended. The contraband was seized and destroyed at the scene as per legal procedures. The accused was arrested and brought to the station for further processing.

The accused was found consuming alcohol in a public place in view of the general public. Upon seeing the police, he attempted to flee, leaving behind an empty brandy bottle and a plastic tumbler. He was apprehended and confessed to the act. The items were seized in the presence of police witnesses as no public witnesses were available. The accused was arrested, and his relatives were informed. The case was registered under the TNP Act.

Complainant_details.Name: Mala
Complainant_details.Address: 28, Periyar Nagar East, Kulithalai, Kulithalai Taluk, Karur District

Incident_details.Location: Karur-Trichy NH Road, near Kalaimagal School, Kulithalai
Incident_details.description: Vijayaprasanna was driving the HYUNDAI i20 car at high speed, recklessly, and negligently when he collided with Bhaskar's two-wheeler, causing Bhaskar to fall and sustain multiple injuries.

Accused_details.Name: Baijur Rahman
Accused_details.Address: 78, Casellithurai Road, S.M. Nagar, Mettupalayam, Coimbatore

Incident_details.description: The accused was found in possession of banned tobacco products, including 300 packets of Hans, 1330 packets of Vimal Pan Masala, 900 packets of V-1 Tobacco, and 32 packets of Cool Lip, which he intended to sell to local shops.
The accused was found in possession of 5 bottles of 180ml HONEY DAY Tamil Nadu government liquor brandy, intended for illegal sale without a valid license or permit.

Complainant_details.Name: Sathyapriya
Complainant_details.Address: Easwariamman Kovil Street, T.N. Puthukudi, Puliyangudi

Incident_details.Location: Easwariamman Kovil Street, T.N. Puthukudi, Puliyangudi
Incident_details.description: The complainant's son, Karunesh, went missing after being left at home to play with neighboring children while she and her mother went to work. Upon returning at 17:00, she found her son missing and was unable to locate him despite searching the area and asking relatives.

The accused was found selling government liquor at a higher price without proper authorization. Upon interrogation, he admitted to the crime. Police seized 5 bottles of 180ML XXX Diamond Rum and destroyed them at the scene due to their open condition.

Incident_details.Location: Mangalam Road, near Kalikovil Shed, Kadaladi
Incident_details.description: The accused was found in possession of 20 bottles (180ML) of ACCORD BRANDY without any government authorization. Upon interrogation, he admitted to storing them for illegal sale. The police seized and destroyed the bottles at the scene.

The accused was found in possession of 5 liters of illicit liquor (Pandi Arrack) in a polythene bag without government authorization. The liquor was seized and destroyed at the scene in the presence of police witnesses.

Complainant_details.Name: A.P. Mohanraj
Complainant_details.Address: No. 36/6, Vaiyapuri Chetty Street, Ammapet, Salem-3

Victim_details.Name: Prithiv Gautam
Victim_details.Address: No. 36/6, Vaiyapuri Chetty Street, Ammapet, Salem-3
Victim_details.Injury_details: Severe head and left hand injuries

Incident_details.Location: Near Vinayaka Mission Kirupananda Variyar Arts & Science College, Salem
Incident_details.description: The accused, riding a Hero Super Splendor bike at high speed and negligently, collided with the victim's Bullet bike (TN 54 M 1257), causing severe injuries to the victim and damage to both vehicles.

The accused Murugan demolished his old house using a JCB and dumped the debris in the complainant’s backyard. When the complainant’s husband questioned this, Murugan verbally abused him. Subsequently, Ambika, Mariammal, and Gayathri joined in, verbally abusing the complainant with derogatory words, pulling her hair, assaulting her, and pushing her to the ground.

The accused was found sitting in a suspicious manner in the dark, covering his head with a cloth. When approached by the police, he attempted to flee but was surrounded and captured. Upon questioning, he provided inconsistent details about his identity. Suspecting his involvement in a potential crime, he was arrested and brought to the station for further investigation.

The complainant's daughter Abinaya, who had recently completed her +2 exams, was friendly with Kalyani and Chithra. On 28-03-2019, Abinaya and Kalyani went out to search for jobs and returned home. On 29-03-2019, when the complainant returned from work at 10:00 AM, she found her daughter missing. Upon inquiry, she learned that Abinaya, Kalyani, and Chithra had left together, and their whereabouts were unknown.

Witnesses.Name: M. Vijayakanth
Witnesses.Address: Kaliamman Kovil Street, T. Vadipatti, Madurai DT

Incident_details.Incident_name: Fraud and Criminal Breach of Trust
Incident_details.description: The complainant's son Sujith, a Civil Engineering graduate, was preparing to go abroad for employment. The accused approached the complainant and promised a well-paying job overseas. Trusting them, the complainant and her family paid ₹2,50,000 along with Sujith’s passport on 03-06-2017. The accused assured a job within 10 days, but after a delay, they sent Sujith to Qatar on 13-07-2017, claiming he had secured a Civil Engineer job with a ₹65,000 salary. Upon arrival, Sujith realized the provided job address did not exist. After multiple complaints, no alternative job was arranged, and Sujith returned to India. When the complainant confronted the accused, they refused to return the money and threatened them.

Incident_details.Description: The complainant, Hema Malini, left home at 11:30 AM to visit Arumanallur Cooperative Bank for a group loan, after giving medicine to her husband, who suffered from chronic stomach pain. Her son was also away. When they returned at 3:00 PM, they found the house locked from inside. With the help of a neighbor, Dinesh, they broke the door and found Murugan hanging from a wooden beam using a thread rope. Hema Malini stated there was no suspicion regarding the death and requested appropriate action.

Complainant_details.Name: Aasirvadham
Complainant_details.Address: South Street, Maruthakulam Village, Tirunelveli District, Now at Mamandur

Incident_details.Description: While Santosh Giri was disposing of leaves outside the hotel, Murali, S/o Srinivasan from Mamandur, verbally abused him using offensive words, questioning why an outsider was working there. Upon hearing the commotion, others gathered, and Murali fled the scene.

Complainant_details.Name: Mukendran
Complainant_details.Address: 5/100, Surankottai East, Surankottai Post, Ramanathapuram Taluk, Ramanathapuram District

Incident_details.Location: Thiruppullani Government Higher Secondary School and Primary Education Office, Ramanathapuram
Incident_details.Incident_name: Verbal Abuse, Caste Discrimination, and Death Threat
Incident_details.description: Mukendran, a teacher, was accused of sexual harassment based on a false petition. When he visited the school and the primary education office to clarify the allegations, the headmistress's husband, Nagaraj, verbally abused him, issued death threats, and insulted his caste. The headmistress, Prema, also claimed that the false petition was filed with the knowledge of senior officials and threatened him.

Complainant_details.Name: D. Naveenkumar
Complainant_details.Address: 175, Puthuthottam, Salavaikkal Palayam, Nagadevam Palayam Post, Gobichettipalayam Taluk, Erode District

Incident_details.Location: Near Ram Nagar Indian Petrol Pump, Thenvadal Road, Dharapuram
Incident_details.description: While Naveenkumar and his friends were walking on Thenvadal Road towards Alangiyam, Dharapuram, a three-wheeler mini-door vehicle (TN 57 V 6134) driven by Palanichamy, under the influence of alcohol and at high speed, negligently hit Naveenkumar and Tamilarasan. As a result, Naveenkumar sustained a head injury, and Tamilarasan suffered injuries on his left knee and right knee. They were taken to Dharapuram Government Hospital by private ambulance with the help of Dhanasekar and Venkatesan.

Incident_details.Incident_name: Public Nuisance Due to Alcohol Consumption
Incident_details.description: During a routine crime prevention patrol, the police found the accused, Prakash, consuming Old Chief Rum in a public place, causing a disturbance. Despite warnings, he continued drinking, leading to his arrest at 16:15. His relatives were informed, and he was brought to the police station by 16:30.

Complainant_details.Name: R. Alagumanickam
Complainant_details.Address: South Street, Manickapuram, Kamarajpuram (Post), Bodinayakanur Taluk

Incident_details.description: The complainant's father, Kalimuthu, was walking home after buying chicken when the accused, driving at high speed and negligently, hit him with his vehicle. Kalimuthu suffered a head injury and nasal bleeding. Nearby people helped and called an ambulance, which admitted him to Theni Government Medical College Hospital. The complainant and her sister are assisting him.
